title: How to Pack a Water Shutoff Valve

steps.title: Locate and shut off water supply to the line that feeds the leaking valve.
steps.content: Locate and shut off water supply to the line that feeds the leaking valve. You may need to shut off water to the entire house if there is no cut off for the line. [1] X Research source Open a faucet to relieve back-pressure on water line.

steps.title: Remove the packing nut with an adjustable wrench.
steps.content: Remove the packing nut with an adjustable wrench. The packing cap is the cap just below the handle. The packing material is behind the nut and one washer. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Carefully remove the old hardened packing from around the stem of the valve.
steps.content: Carefully remove the old hardened packing from around the stem of the valve. Don't damage brass surfaces. Use a toothpick or dowel rod to clear compacted material. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Re-wrap the clean stem with new packing.
steps.content: Re-wrap the clean stem with new packing. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tighten packing nut enough to compress packing material.
steps.content: Tighten packing nut enough to compress packing material. Do not over-tighten. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Open water supply.
steps.content: Open water supply. [6] X Research source

steps.title: If stem still leaks, tighten packing nut a little more.
steps.content: If stem still leaks, tighten packing nut a little more.

steps.title: If valve still leaks, the valve stem may not be seating properly due to wear.
steps.content: If valve still leaks, the valve stem may not be seating properly due to wear. [7] X Research source
